result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua W West was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua W West

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua W West in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Defendant Joshua W West in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:23 AM. Called 15CM149, 15CF159, 15CT25 and 16CF80. 16TR125 and 16TR126 are also on the calendar. State - resolved - joint recommendation on all matters; on 15CT25 - #1 - amend to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle with $300.00 forfeiture plus costs totalling $582.50; 15CM149 - plead to both counts as alleged - 30 days in FC jail on each count and court costs on each count - concurrent to each other and concurrent to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving; on 15CF159 - amend count #1 to possession of THC - 1st offense - contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) -  $300 fine plus costs and surcharges -  6 months jail - concurrent to any jail that the defendant is currently serving, counts #3 and #4 - 9 months on each count - concurrent to each other and to any sentence that the defendant is currentlys serving, #2 - DRI; 16CF80 - plead G to counts #3 and #5 as alleged and G/NC to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, remaining counts DRI, on counts #2, #3, ad #5 - 1 year in FC jail on each count - concurrent to each other and to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving, #1 - acknowledge one prior OWI conviction - 30 days in FC jail term - consecutive to jail that he is currently serving, $1570.00 fine, 13 month DL revocation and 13 month IID requirement. Sierh agrees but states the plea questionnaire has NC pleas on all counts being plead to. State - must be G pleas on counts #3 and #5 on 16CF80 for stated reasons. Sierh has no objections to that and West agrees an agrees to the plea offer as stated on the record. Court - has all four plea questionnaires for each case and reviews them. Court - 15CT25 - amends only count to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle. West pleads NC to amended count #1 on 15CT25. 16CF80 - West pleads NC to count #1 as alleged, pleads NC to count #2 as alleged, pleads G to count #3 as alleged, pleads G to count #5 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts on 16CF80 (#4, #6, #7, #8, #9, #10, #11 and #12). 15CM149 - West pleads NC to count #1 as alleged, pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. 15CF159 - Court amends count #1 to possession of THC as 1st offense contrary to 961.41(3g)(e), West pleads NC to amended count #1, pleads NC to count #3 as alleged, pleads NC to count #4 as alleged, Court dismisses and reads in count #2 on 15CF159. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and right to JT by entering his plea, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State has complied with victim notification requirements with no response or restitution requested - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Siehr makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for huber and also asks that the defendant be allowed to work on his grandfather's farm (Horses ETC). West makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CT25 - sentences to $300.00 forfeiture plus costs totalling $582.50 - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CJ; 16CF80 - count #1 - 30 days in FC jail - consectuive to any other sentence that he is currently serving, fine of $1570.00 - 60 DTP/CJ, revoke DL for 13 months, IID on DL and any vehicle titled in his name for 13 months commencing upon issuance of a valid DL; #2, #3 and #5 - 1 year in FC jail - concurrent to each other and to count #1 and to any other sentence that he is currently serving, court costs on each count (including DNA surcharge) - paid in 60 days/CO; 15CM149 - #1 - 30 days in FC jail, costs, DNA surcharge, #2 - 30 days in FC jail, costs, DNA surcharges - all concurrent to each other and to any sengence; 15CF159 - #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs - paid in 60 days/CJ, 6 months in county jail - concurrent to counts #1 and #2 and to any sentence he is currently serving, costs and DNA surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, counts #3 and #4 - 9 months on each count - concurrent to each other  and to any other sentence he is serving, court costs including DNA surcharges - 60 DTP/CO, huber allowed on each sentence per the normal policy of FOSO, take any bond posted for pay fines, credit for 41 days on all cases except for count #1 on 16CF80, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, submit DNA sample, 60 days to pay all fines and then civil judgment. Clerk asks about disposition on 16TR125 and 16TR126. State is not willing to dismiss the citations. Court gives options to the defendant, either plead to them or ask for CT. West pleads NG again to both of those citations, clerk will set those citations for a CT in front of Judge Rhode, 10/20/16 at 10:00 AM.  Adjourned at 12:13 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriel G. Siehr in court and appears via telephone as does Judge Rhode.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:15 PM. Called 15CF159, 16CF80, 15CM149 and 15CT25 plus two traffic matters (16TR125 and 16TR126). All matters will be set for JT on 10/20/16 with 16CF80 as #1, 15CF159 as #2, 15CM149 as #3 and 15CT25 as #4, traffic matters to follow. Court wants jury instructions and MIL one week in advance of JT. If matters are resolved, these cases will then be PLEAS on same date and time. Court continues bond on all matters.  Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Gabriel G. Siehr appears via telephone.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear in court with leave of court. Called 2:55 PM. Called 15CT25, 15CM149 & 15CF159. 15CT25 - needs to be scheduled for JT, Kessler was not properly retained on this case. She was retained on 15CM149 and 15CF159 but recently has filed a withdrawal of counsel which the court accepted. New counsel Gabriel Siehr has been appointed and new case 16CF80 was recently filed and has also had a substitution filed, assignment has not been done yet. Off record for scheduling, 2:57 PM. Back on the record, 3:02 PM. Court will schedule all three cases for FPT  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from Attorney Siehr asking for adjournment of trial on 4/4/16

Defendant Joshua W West in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:17 PM. Also called 15CM149 and 15CT25. Court - set for MH and FPT on 15CF159 and FPT on other two matters. Court does have defense motion. State has informed the Court that his witness (officer) is not available today. Court - asking if the parties will stipulate to any of the facts in Kessler's motion. State agrees except that both parties stipulate that the matter was not a traffic stop for stated reasons. Kessler responds and will agree to that stipulation and also stipulates that Officer Wilson's testimony is as it set forth in the motion and believes the Court has a copy of it. The Court does not have a copy of the transcript so Kessler's provides Court with her copy of the transcript. State does not plan on calling any other witnesses. Kessler does not have any other witnesses per the stipulation that the defendant's vehicle had a passenger side mirror and State has stipulated to that fact. Court has the facts it needs at this point and the transcript, parties can make argument for motion. State puts their side on the record. Kessler makes argument for her motion. State responds and asks that motion be denied. Kessler responds. Court makes statement for parties to argue. State responds. Kessler responds. State responds. Court makes ruling - does not find that the stop was a terry stop - denies motion. Kessler asks for a chance to brief the matter and withhold ruling. Court responds - can file a motion for reconsideration as ruling has already been made. Court continues bond on all matters. Kessler states that she has only officially been retained on the CF case but would like matters to track together. Court - 15CT25 should be scheduled for a JT. State informs Court that his offer on 15CT25 is still valid today. Recess to talk to defendant (3:48 PM). Recalled at 4:29 PM with same appearances. Court puts back on the record that the defense motion was denied and orders that the transcripts referenced today should be filed with the Court and made part of the record. Kessler moves to withdraw as counsel on 15CT25 and 15CM149 for stated reasons. Court will allow the withdrawal of counsel on those two matters (15CT25 and 15CM149). Court asks defendant how he now wishes to proceed. West states that he denies the offers made by the state for 15CT25 and 15CM149. Court asks defendant how he wants to proceed on those two matters. Court continues bond on all cases and sets 15CT25 (#1) and 15CM149 (#2) on 4/5/16 at 8:30 AM (#1) and inform Court if that day is unavailable if any attorney is retained. Court sets 15CF159 for STC on 4/5/16 at 9:00 AM.  Jury trial scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua W West in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:06 AM. Status conferences for 15CM149 and 15CT25. Here for PH on 15CF159. State calls Darrel Wilson as witness. Wilson sworn in 11:07 AM, state directs. State offers exhibit #1 - Certified copy of JOC from case 13CF48. No objection from defense counsel. Record will reflect identification of defendant, 11:18 AM. Kessler directs witness Wilson, 11:19 AM. State - objects, out of scope. Objection sustained, 11:24 AM. Witness Wilson excused, 11:24 AM. Defense has no witnesses. Court - finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files INFO which mirrors the complaint. Kessler - waives further reading of INFO, proceed to ARGN, asks to stand mute and enter NG pleas on all counts. Kessler intends on filing motion. Both motion hearing and FPT will be scheduled.  Other cases to track. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 03:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Called 3:23 PM. Also called 15CT25 & 15CF159. Defendant Joshua W West in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Kessler waives further reading of complaints and enters NG pleas on misdemeanor cases. Preliminary Hearing requested on 15CF159 and is willing to waive time limits.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 12/4/15 at 11:00 AM.  15CT25 & 15CM149 cases to be scheduled as STC same date and time.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua W West in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:52 AM. Also called 15CT25 and 15CM149. West stated off the record that he has retained Sheila Kessler but she was not available today, he still working on the paperwork for retaining her. Defendant states he needs another $300.00 to retain Attorney Kessler. Court will continue bond on all matters and sets all matters for another AIA. Attorney Kessler can appear telephonically if needed on that date and time and if that date is not available, she should contact JA for another date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua W West in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Joshua W West in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:52 AM. Also called 15CT25. Burns appears specially today and explains that she is here to try to argue for signature bond. Court reads charges and penalties in both cases. West understands charges and penalties. Burns asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. 15CM149 - bond at $750.00 cash, with no consumption of alcohol. 15CT25 - $250.00 cash - no consumption of alcohol.. State objects to signature bond on new case that is not filed yet at $1000.00 cash for stated reasons. Burns still requests signature bond. West - still on PO hold, states PO hold will be lifted if he gets a signature bond. Court - bond on unfiled case - reduce to $2500 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 10:45 am.
